sen.j: 後光厳天皇（ごこうごんてんのう 延元3年/暦応元年3月2日（1338年3月23日） - 文中3年/応安7年1月29日（1374年3月12日） 在位：正平8年/文和元年8月17日（1352年9月25日） - 建徳2年/応安4年 3月23日（1371年4月9日））は、南北朝時代の北朝第4代天皇である。
sen.e: Emperor Go-Kogon (March 23rd, 1338 - March 12th, 1374), his reign was September 25th, 1352 - April 9th, 1371, he was the fourth Emperor of the Northern Dynasty during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties.

Emperor Go-Kogon (March 23rd, 1338 - March 12th, 1374), his reign was from September 25th, 1352 to April 9th, 1371, he was the fourth Emperor of the Northern Dynasty during the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties.

Emperor Gokogon (March 23, 1338 - March 12, 1374), his reign was from September 25, 1352 to April 9, 1371, he was the fourth Emperor of the Northern Court during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts.

sen.e: He was excluded from the successive Emperors since the Southern Dynasty was considered as standard era in 1911. (Since then the Northern Dynasty which leads to current Imperial line, was considered as standard era.)

sen.j: 1351年、北朝を擁する足利尊氏が南朝に帰順し、皇統が一時的に南朝へ統一される観応の擾乱正平一統が成立する。
sen.e: In 1351, after the leader of the Northern Dynasty, Takauji ASHIKAGA submitted to the Southern Dynasty, there was an unification of the Imperial line in the Shohei era of the Kanno Disturbance, and the Imperial line was given to the Southern Dynasty temporally.

sen.j: 北朝は京都を奪還するものの、南朝方が撤退する際に北朝の光厳天皇（父）、光明天皇（叔父）、崇光天皇（兄）及び皇太子の直仁親王を吉野へ連行する。
sen.e: After the Northern Dynasty recaptured Kyoto, when the Southern Dynasty evacuated, Emperor Kogon (father), Emperor Komyo (uncle), Emperor Suko (brother) and Crown Prince, Prince Naohito were taken away to Yoshino.

When the Northern Dynasty recaptured Kyoto, the Southern Dynasty evacuated and Emperor Kogon (father), Emperor Komyo (uncle), Emperor Suko (brother) and Crown Prince, Prince Naohito were taken away to Yoshino.

When the Northern Court recaptured Kyoto, the Southern Court evacuated and Emperor Kogon (father), Emperor Komyo (uncle), Emperor Suko (brother) and Crown Prince, Imperial Prince Naohito were taken away to Yoshino.

sen.j: 三上皇の拉致により、北朝では公事が停止し、院宣を発する治天の君や三種の神器も無い状態であった。
sen.e: After three ex-Emperors were taken away, the public affairs were suspended in the Northern Dynasty, and there was no Chikun no Kimi who give a command from the ex-emperor or they did not have three sacred emblems of the Imperial Family.

sen.j: 弥仁は妙法院への入室が予定されていたが、京都の足利義詮は二条良基と相談の上、北朝再建のために広義門院に要請し、延臣に擁立されて即位した古代の継体天皇の先例も引照して、8月17日に弥仁は践祚され、後光厳天皇として即位。
sen.e: Although Prince Iyahito was expected to enter into Myohoin, after Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA of Kyoto discussed the situation with Yoshimoto NIJO, they asked help for Kogimon in, Prince Iyahito had an order of accession to the throne and enthroned as Emperor Go-Kogen, followed the example of ancient Emperor Keitai who enthroned after being appointed by 延臣.
sen.cmt: 延臣の読み方が不明でした。
sen.e: Although Prince Iyahito was expected to enter Myohoin, after Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA of Kyoto discussed the situation with Yoshimoto NIJO, they asked for help for Kogimon in, Prince Iyahito received the order to succeed to the throne and was enthroned as Emperor Go-Kogen, following the example of ancient Emperor Keitai who was enthroned after being appointed by 延臣.

Although Prince Iyahito was expected to enter Myohoin, after Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA of Kyoto discussed the situation with Yoshimoto NIJO, they asked for help for Kogimon-in, Prince Iyahito received the order to succeed to the throne and was enthroned as Emperor Gokogon in August 17, following the example of ancient Emperor Keitai who was enthroned after being appointed by Enshin (延臣).

sen.j: 後光厳の正統性の欠如などで北朝権威は弱体化し、南朝は京を奪還するなど活発に活動、後光厳も京都から近江国などへ下向することも何度かあった。
sen.e: The Northern Dynasty got weak due to the lack of orthodoxy of Emperor Go-Kogon, on the other hand the Southern Dynasty positively acted to recapture Kyoto, Emperor Go-Kogon came down to Kyoto to Omi Province several times.

The Northern Dynasty became weak due to the lack of orthodoxy on the part of Emperor Go-Kogon, to the contrary, the Southern Dynasty took positive steps to recapture Kyoto, Emperor Go-Kogon went down to Kyoto to Omi Province several times.

The Northern Court became weak due to the lack of orthodoxy on the part of Emperor Gokogon, to the contrary, the Southern Court took positive steps to recapture Kyoto, Emperor Gokogon went down to Kyoto to Omi Province several times.

sen.j: 1370年（応安2年8月）には、第一皇子の緒仁親王（後円融天皇）への譲位を幕府に諮問するが、1357年に帰京していた兄の崇光が自らの皇子である伏見宮栄仁親王への皇統返還を主張する。
sen.e: In 1370 the Emperor requested the government for advice why the first Prince, Prince Ohito (the Emperor Go-Enyu) was passed the throne, his brother, Emperor Suko who returned to Kyoto in 1357, insisted to let his own Prince, Fushimi no Miya Prince Yoshihito to succeed to the throne.

In 1370 the Emperor requested the government's advice as to why the first Prince, Prince Ohito (the Emperor Go-Enyu) was passed over for the throne, his brother, Emperor Suko who returned to Kyoto in 1357, insisted to have his own son, Fushimi no Miya Prince Yoshihito succeed to the throne.

In 1370 the Emperor requested the government's advice as to why the first Prince, Imperial Prince Ohito (the Emperor Goenyu) was passed over for the throne, his brother, Emperor Suko who returned to Kyoto in 1357, insisted to have his own son, Fushimi no Miya Imperial Prince Yoshihito succeed to the throne.

sen.j: 幕府では3代将軍足利義満のもと、管領の細川頼之が後光厳の意思を尊重するべきであると回答し、翌1371年（応安4年3月23日）に、緒仁へ譲位して院政を敷く。
sen.e: In Kamakura government, under the supervision of the third Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, a shogunal deputy (kanrei), Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA answered back to respect Emperor Go-Kogon's intention, on the following year of 1371, the Emperor passed the throne to Prince Ohito and started ruling cloister government.

In the Kamakura government, under the supervision of the third Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, a shogunal deputy (kanrei), Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA answered Emperor Go-Kogon's, and the following year, 1371, the Emperor passed the throne to Prince Ohito who ruled a cloistered government.

In the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), under the supervision of the third Shogun Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, a shogunal deputy (kanrei), Yoriyuki HOSOKAWA answered Emperor Gokogon's, and the following year, 1371 (March 23), the Emperor passed the throne to Prince Ohito and started a cloistered government.
